episode_summary: This episode features facts from the hosts' new book, covering topics such as the rarity of four-year-old mice compared to centenarians, the Pinkerton Detective Agency's work for Coca-Cola, the magnetic properties of Mauritania's highest point, and a plane's emergency landing due to farting sheep.

facts.fact: Four-year-old mice are less common than 100-year-old humans.
The detective agency that hunted Butch Cassidy also worked for Coca-Cola.
You cannot get to the highest point of Mauritania with a compass.
In 2015, a plane had to make an emergency landing after the smoke alarm was triggered by farting sheep.
